name: Great Britain at 2008 Olympics Quiz | Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which British cyclist won three gold medals at Beijing?
questions.explanation:
Chris Hoy.

	Chris, from Edinburgh, won the men's keirin and men's sprint, and was part of the men's team sprint winning trio, alongside Jamie Staff and Jason Kenny.

questions.text: Britain's only track gold was won by Christine Ohuruogu in which event?
questions.explanation:
400 metres.

	Christine, from London, added Olympic gold to her 2007 World Championship crown.

questions.text: James DeGale won boxing gold for Britain at which weight divison?
questions.explanation:
Middleweight.

	James, from London, outpointed Cuba's Emilio Correa in the final to become Britain's first Olympic champion at Middleweight since Chris Finnegan in 1968.

questions.text: Sarah Ayton, Sarah Webb and Pippa Wilson won gold in which sailing class?
questions.explanation:
Yngling.

	The two Sarahs had won this event in 2004 alongside Shirley Robertson, and, with Pippa Wilson on board, repeated the feat at Qingdao.

questions.text: Who became the first British woman to win a swimming gold medal since Anita Lonsborough in 1960?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca Adlington.

	Rebecca, from Mansfield, won both the 400m and 800m freestyle races, and set a new world record at 800m.

questions.text: Britain has an excellent pedigree in Olympic rowing, and won two gold medals at Beijing, in which events?
questions.correct: Lightweight men's double sculls and men's coxless four
options: Women's double sculls and men's lightweight fours
Women's quadruple sculls and men's single sculls
Men's eights and men's lightweight fours
questions.explanation:
Lightweight men's double sculls and men's coxless four.

	Britain won her third straight gold in the men's coxless four event, with Tom James, Steve Williams, Pete Reed and Andy Hodge on board. Mark Hunter and Zac Purchase won the lightweight double sculls.

questions.text: Britain's first gold at Beijing was won by Nicole Cooke in which sport?
questions.explanation:
Cycling.

	Nicole, from Swansea, won the women's road race.

questions.text: Ben Ainslie won gold for the third consecutive Olympics in which sport?
questions.explanation:
Sailing.

	Ben, from Macclesfield, successfully defended his Finn class title from 2004. In 2000, he won gold in the Laser class.

questions.text: Tim Brabants won gold in which canoeing event?
questions.explanation:
Flatwater K1 1000m.

	Tim, from Chertsey, beat defending champion Erik Veraas of Norway into second place.

questions.text: How many gold medals did Great Britain win at the 2008 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation:
19.

	Britain won 19 gold, 13 silver and 15 bronze medals to finish in fourth place on the medals table, her best performance since London 1908, when only 22 nations took part.
